Description: Almond-shaped artificial eye in several fragments with small chips missing. No trace of pigment on the surface. Material it is made of is not identified (perhaps faience or clay?). Thick layer of black resinous substance at the back with clear textile impression. The eye would have originally been placed on the orbit of a mummified individual.
Curator's comments: It is possible that artificial eyes EA 90810 and EA 90811 origianlly formed a pair. Published in: P.H.K. Gray, 'Artificial eyes in mummies', JEA 57 (1971) , pl. XXXIV (2nd row, first from the right of fig. 1)
